intro: Malanea evenosa, commonly known as the smoothleaf malanea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
